bibl.title: Hellenistic Epinician.
bibl.note: Contribution presented at the four-day conference 'Epinician: An International Conference on the Victory Ode' which took place on July 5-9 2006 in Bloomsbury, London. - 1. End of 'epinikion', boom of competitions. - 2. A new body for the epinician soul. - 3. Praise engraved in stone. - 4. 'Females of the dynasty'. - 5. Materializing Victory: the relationship between epigrammatic epinician and statuary. - Uses several fragments preserved on papyrus (in part. poems of Callimachus and Posidippus).

bibl.title: Receiving the Komos. Ancient & Modern Receptions of the Victory Ode

bibl.seg: 364 Callimachus Carmina varia Graeca Posidippus Pellensis
Peter Agócs, Chris Carey & Richard Rawles (edd.), Receiving the Komos. Ancient & Modern Receptions of the Victory Ode = BICS. Supplement 112 (London, 2012) pp. 37-55.

Contribution presented at the four-day conference 'Epinician: An International Conference on the Victory Ode' which took place on July 5-9 2006 in Bloomsbury, London. - 1. End of 'epinikion', boom of competitions. - 2. A new body for the epinician soul. - 3. Praise engraved in stone. - 4. 'Females of the dynasty'. - 5. Materializing Victory: the relationship between epigrammatic epinician and statuary. - Uses several fragments preserved on papyrus (in part. poems of Callimachus and Posidippus).
